course.subject: COMP
course.name: Start Me Up: Creating Value with Information Technology
course.description: This is a "startup garage" course covering elements of founding new and innovative business ventures in information technology sector. Topics include the entrepreneurial risk-taking value-creation mindset, business model development, business plan, fundraising and investment, role and protection of intellectual properties, technology-market gap and product-market fit, and growth and exit strategies. Case studies of successful and failed ventures will be discussed. In-class student participation and presentation are expected. Business and non-engineering students are also welcome. Research postgraduate students are expected to develop proof-of-concept prototypes and business plans based on their research findings and technologies.
